title: Pitch deck outline for Blockchain Series A startups
summary: Projected deck structure for Blockchain founders raising a Series A round. Includes section goals, proof points, and investor expectations for this stage.

sections.title: Problem
sections.goal: Show the pain and why now matters.
sections.guidance: Quantify the problem with a clear market shift or constraint.

sections.title: Solution
sections.goal: Explain the product in one sentence.
sections.guidance: Focus on the core workflow and the wedge you own.

sections.title: Market
sections.guidance: Start with the first buyer segment and a realistic wedge.

sections.title: Traction
sections.guidance: Highlight pilots, LOIs, or early revenue.

sections.title: Business model
sections.guidance: Show pricing logic tied to value delivered.

sections.title: Moat
sections.guidance: Data, IP, approvals, or operational scale.

sections.title: Team
sections.guidance: Emphasize domain expertise and execution history.

sections.title: Protocol security
sections.guidance: Detail audits, monitoring, and token economics.

sections.title: Series A milestones
sections.goal: Highlight proof points for Series A.
sections.guidance: Detail the specific milestones investors expect for Blockchain Series A.

sections.title: Blockchain go-to-market wedge (Series A)
sections.goal: Explain your entry point for Blockchain.
sections.guidance: Show a focused wedge that fits Blockchain buyers at the Series A stage.

sections.title: Blockchain proof points
sections.guidance: Use data or pilots specific to Blockchain to prove momentum at Series A.
